software.leonov.system.monitor

Class LazySystemMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.system.monitor.LazySystemMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, SystemMonitor

    public final class LazySystemMonitor
extends Object
    A thread-safe SystemMonitor implementation that refreshes usage metrics on demand.

    This monitor employs a debouncing mechanism to prevent excessive resource consumption. Usage metrics are updated when either getCpuUsage() or getMemoryUsage() is called, but only if a refresh threshold has elapsed since the last update. A custom threshold can be specified when this class is created.

    No underlying resources are managed by this monitor. The SystemMonitor.close() method is a no-op and can be safely ignored.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

      • withDefaultRefreshThreshold

        public static LazySystemMonitor withDefaultRefreshThreshold()

        Returns:

      • withRefreshThreshold

        public static LazySystemMonitor withRefreshThreshold(Duration refreshThreshold)
        Creates a new LazySystemMonitor configured with the specified refresh threshold.

        Usage metrics are updated when either getCpuUsage() or getMemoryUsage() is called, unless the specified refreshThreshold time has not elapsed since the last update, in which case the most recently cached values are returned.

        Parameters:
        refreshThreshold - the minimum time interval that must elapse between updates
        Returns:
        a new LazySystemMonitor configured with the specified refresh threshold
